bow: feel like do belong among any moms half crunchy pregnant with boy 27 weeks this thursday and have 19 month old son still breastfeeding we co sleep work from home and we do guess semi attachment parenting he never been one for wrap but do do cio or any other sleep training if he cries he hugged also had pain management during my last labor and planning on pain management for this labor vaccinate and have an ob gyn with no doula feel like too crunchy for moms who are more guess streamline but not au naturale enough for those green moms where do belong you do need friends with identical parenting styles choices as you if you wants friends then check out community resources events or meetup com and meet people if you meet and click you win if you do click move on it pretty simple its not even necessarily about friends its more like do have community that can really go to for advice that is similar to my ideals like apart of few facebook groups but feel like ca give or get advice because do fit within any specific parenting lifestyle feel exactly the same way am definitely crunchier than my real life mom friends but too main stream for lot of moms meet at very crunchy family center so basically on my own try to look at both sides perspectives when looking for advice and come up with my own plan if you ever like to chat pm me your style sounds very similar to mine you sound just like me will be your friend ve been considering starting middle of the road mommies subreddit for those of us who are semi crunchy chewy breastfeed co sleep unwillingly baby wear use disposable diapers and give birth in hospitals with all the drugs they will give me never could do cio but not for lack of trying it just did work on my kids pick regular forum for moms then take what you want from their advice my general parenting advice is if it makes sense for your family try it if it sounds like hogwash then do you be surprised there are lot of middle of the road moms all of my friends are so am we re just the less vocal ones we do feel the need to preach from soap boxes about how our way is right because we just do what we feel is right based on our family needs have two year old am grad student stay at home mom tried breastfeeding but my body would let me we use disposable diapers we only co sleep when he sick and wo sleep in his bed we cio for naps but we still rock him to sleep at night and he would cry in wrap once he got over months old so hardly wore him after that vaccinate use regular ob gyn office with midwives and no doula and had drug free birth beside the fact had to be induced do know who all these people are on the internet but think we re real people we do what best for our family our kids and most importantly ourselves think feel lot better about my parenting methods when comparing them to other real people off line than when trying to glean advice from people on the internet because on the internet people can say they do whatever they want they do have to be real feel yah belong to numerous groups and just take the tid bits of information that apply to me and move on have fb friend that is constantly posting some really great crunch information that enjoy but then she follows up most of her posts with the same never let my baby cio or only good parents sleep with their babies just roll my eyes and think to each his own think thats the thing middle of the roaders dont go about preaching their ideals to everyone its the parents who take hard stance one way or another that make the majority of the posts pretty similar to you and identify with the crunchy moms even though work outside the home full time vaccinate hospital birthed with an epidural and without doula etc use standard cleaners and other household products shop mostly at the regular grocery store and do buy much organic sometimes have felt like not crunchy enough for the crunchy crowd but that is more true online than in person and when was less familiar with the group have discovered that crunchy moms really encompasses two groups that happen to have lot of overlap there is ap attachment parenting and there is nl natural living ap is about how you interact with your child breastfeeding co sleeping no cio baby wearing no spank gentle discipline etc nl is about what products you buy use ingest cloth diapers anti vaccines natural cleaners organic food etc find that do most of the ap stuff but not much of the nl stuff though as am exposed more to the nl stuff have chosen it more my first wore paper diapers and my second wore cloth for example we are trying to buy more local food like at the farmer market things like that anyway have found that even though do do all the crunchy stuff still feel that identify more with the crunchy moms than the mainstream moms due to the things that *do* do that are crunchy which the mainstream folks still seem to think are weird at best or harmful at worst guess feel judgement from the mainstream moms for the crunchy things do but not the reverse from the crunchy moms would subscribe to middle of the road moms group although fall little more towards the ap nl side of things than relate to your parenting style and do identify more with the crunchy moms because my passion for certain ap choices seems out of place with more mainstream moms but in my experience ve had more open all to the mainstream moms it usually makes me freak and some even think it bordering on abuse nice ll look more towards countries outside of the can see why it would make difference with our society lot of things have been forced into one extreme or another just because its out of the norm yeah this is kinda where am now most of my in person friends do share any of my parenting styles so most of my advice is limited to online forums then when seek advice there feel so much judgement for not doing things the same that just give up trying to find an accepting community maybe super lucky then my group of real life mom friends who met through my community shop and stroll program have varied parenting styles and we do judge each other half of us use disposables half cloth some cio some not most breastfed at least for while but think there is at least one or two ff delivery experience varied which is great for sharing birth stories the only thing we all do is let are kids pretty much eat dirt we used to let them crawl around the floor at the mall while we chatted after class so the only parent type we re missing is the germaphobe guess but somehow do think they would like us feel like it easier to make friends here vancouver since everyone gets that one year off work so while you re out looking for friends for your year off you re not only finding sahms you re finding working parents work at home people who will go back to work or not there just huge variety of parents to meet during the one year off yeah there are issues that judged on by both extremes have gotten few comments about breastfeeding while pregnant but because of my job breastfeeding counselor and lactation educator people who are concerned about my breastfeeding take it more as an educational moment than really anything else really wish there was that sense of community here also think its definitely determined by where you re living from the southwest us and majority of the moms here fall more under the mainstream parenting and so when try to find people that fall outside of that realm its so exaggerated extreme and judgemental and understand why they are because they ve been shunned away from the mainstream mothering community but then this leaves me with really no where to turn for advice but online have mommy friends in real life but find that with lot of their advice it just does fit in to what feels right to me in my experience the crunchy moms know are more careful and considered of their words they are aware that their choices may seem unusual to others they phrase things like in our family we have chosen to xyz or have you considered xyz they know that this is what everyone else chooses and they present it like an option that you may not be aware of wheras the mainstream moms feel less open to the existence of other choices they phrase things like you need to spank that kid or else he going to end up spoiled brat or we *had* to let him cio or else he would have *never* learned to sleep everything always feels so black and white from them like there is only one way and you are always backed into corner with no other options this kind of approach is really off putting to me not that think they are doing it intentionally or with malice but it tends to put me on the defensive and makes me feel less comfortable with this group sure that not everyone experience but that been mine you got ta take the advice you get and mold it to your style as for the judgement take it with grain of salt as long as your kids are happy and healthy as long as you re happy that means what you are doing is right for your family and that all that matters every mom thinks what they do is the right way and the way that everyone should do it because it works for them most moms go into all knowing mommy mode and forget that everyone life is different and get defensive when someone tries to tell them otherwise do what works in your life and what benefits your family do talk to other moms about how to discipline or how to raise my child because know ll get different conflicting answer from every one of them and even when times are hard and want advice will ask but wo take
